pr_title: resting-state HRF mediated BOLD Simulation in TVB
pr_body: The implementation uses retrieved resting-state HRF (https://github.com/BIDS-Apps/rsHRF/tree/master/rsHRF) for BOLD simulations (instead of the Balloon-Windkessel model). The HRF is obtained from an input file and upsampled to the model's sampling rate, and then convolved with the neural states to produce the BOLD response.

pr_title: WIP Add resting-state HRF mediated Bold response using input from text file
pr_body:
This supplements the existing workflow for BOLD simulation. Instead of computing an identical HRF for all the regions, we use region-wise HRF (obtained by deconvolving the emperical region-wise BOLD Time-Series) for simulations (https://www.nitrc.org/projects/rshrf, https://github.com/BIDS-Apps/rsHRF). The rsHRF is provided as input from a file.

**Additions:**
1. _rsHRF_file_ attribute which takes the path of the input file.
2. __from_file_ variable (binary: {0, 1}) which signifies whether HRF is computed or taken as input.
3. _get_hrf_ function hich obtains the input from the text-file.
4. changes in _compute_hrf_  to upsample the input HRF for convolution.
5. changes in _sample_ to perform region-wise convolution.

This does not make any alterations to the existing workflow for BOLD simulation. In case of no input-file being provided, the default workflow is adopted.
